intro: Hieraciodes dioscoridis, commonly known as the Greek violet, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open woodlands or along coastal areas. It has a compact growth habit and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
